definition: to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Kuguan member Liu Xinghua transformation of the powder keg full of praise.
sentences.chinese: 庫管員劉興華對火藥庫改造讚不絕口。

sentences.english: Big watermelon seeds with a distinctive taste must come in for your profuse praise.
sentences.chinese: 闊板西瓜子，口味獨特，令您讚不絕口。

sentences.english: Mother rhapsodized about your beautiful kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 母親對你們美觀的廚房讚不絕口。

sentences.english: I just heard about it from a friend and he was just raving about it.
sentences.chinese: 我從一個朋友那裏聽說的，他對那裏讚不絕口。

sentences.english: After upstairs and downstair neighbour will look around, be profuse in praise.
sentences.chinese: 樓上樓下的鄰居來參觀之後都讚不絕口。

sentences.english: Now I understand why readers rave about this book.
sentences.chinese: 我現明白讀者爲何對這本書讚不絕口了。

sentences.english: HR reps and other experts also sang the praises of this year`s competitors.
sentences.chinese: 一些人事代表及其他專家對本屆選手們也是讚不絕口。

sentences.english: The new badge design has drawn praise from Lord Attenborough and Mourinho.
sentences.chinese: 阿坦波羅和茉莉尼奧都對新隊徽讚不絕口。

sentences.english: They saw him often, and to his other recommendations was now added that of general unreserve .
sentences.chinese: 她們常常看到他，對他讚不絕口，又說他坦白爽直。

sentences.english: The cured food, a delicacy in summer, enjoys profuse praise.
sentences.chinese: 醃臘商品，夏令佳餚，令您讚不絕口。

sentences.english: Every presentation expert extolls the power of stories.
sentences.chinese: 所有的演說高手都對故事的力量讚不絕口。

sentences.english: His home town of Santa Clarita, Calif. , erupted in praise.
sentences.chinese: 他的家鄉加州桑塔克萊裏塔對他讚不絕口。

definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
